intro: Lippia rehmannii, commonly known as Mexican mint or wild mint, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, mint-scented leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has slender, square stems. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in clusters. Lippia rehmannii is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb.
